        "cityName": "Sevilla",
        "monumentName": "Giralda",
        "monumentDescription": "The Giralda is the bell tower of the Seville Cathedral in Seville, Spain. It was originally built as the minaret for the Great Mosque of Seville in Al-Andalus, Moorish Spain, during the reign of the Almohad dynasty, with a Renaissance-style top subsequently added by the Catholics after the expulsion of the Muslims from the area.",

        "lenght": 10.0,

    "countryName": "Chile",
    "cityName": "Santiago de Chile",
    "monumentName": "La Moneda Palace",
    "monumentDescription": "La Moneda Palace is the seat of the President of the Republic of Chile. It also houses the offices of three cabinet ministers: the Interior, General Secretariat of the Presidency, and General Secretariat of the Government. It is located in the capital, Santiago.",
    "photoUrl": "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6f/Palacio_de_La_Moneda.jpg/800px-Palacio_de_La_Moneda.jpg",

    "latitude": -33.4445
}
